page.title: 01THE WITCHES CAIRN
page.content: Gently rolling hills covered in heather and rough grazing dominated by the Bothwell water and its four tributaries. Several footpaths traverse the area as the Lammermuirs are popular with hillwalkers. Blackface sheep are kept out on the hills all year rounds and when the snow covers the land the shepherds have to try and take hay to the sheep. Red Grouse, Curlew, Peewit, Golden Plover can be seen on the hills. Recently the powerlines from Torness Nuclear Power Station have been erected across this area.
